titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lillian Hoban Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:03

did.unittitle: Lillian Hoban papers

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 83 (audiovisual materials): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 84 (digital media): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, Inc. on the Jockey Hollow Fund, 2013.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Papers and correspondence, circa 1950s-1980s. II. Writings and artwork, 1961-1997. III. Posters, circa 1970-1994. IV. Audiovisual materials, 1968-1994. V. Electronic media, circa 2000.

bioghist.head: Lillian Hoban (1925-1998)
bioghist.p: Lillian Hoban was an American illustrator and children's author.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lillian Hoban Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Lillian Hoban Collection. Related materials: Russell Hoban Papers (GEN MSS 1436). Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of writings, drawings, posters, correspondence, other papers, and audiovisual materials. The writings and drawings document Lillian Hoban's career as a children's author and illustrator, including the Frances and Arthur books and her many collaborations with other authors including Miriam Cohen and Johanna Hurwitz. Audiovisual materials and born digital electronic media include interviews with Hoban and her then husband Russell Hoban.

scopecontent.p: "Where Do The Animals Go When It Rains," "Everyone's Favorite First Grade," and Celebrate Children's book week with the Onondaga County Public Library; Meet Lillian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous material including correspondence from editors, (includes one Ursula Nordstrom letter, dated October 1, 1969) a partial unidentified, unpublished manuscript, one poster, (slightly torn) "Hooray for Lillian Hoban Books," and other material.

did.unittitle: Interviews with Russell and Lillian Hoban, Pathways Educational Series, Highwood Hills
Grade 2 Letters to Mr. and Mrs. Hoban

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A note on the box of the audiotape reel reads: Dear Mrs. Hoban, The class and I would love to have you, your husband and your family visit us. A little bird told us you did stop in Lynn one time. The children could have a Ba[?] Parade. You might enjoy that. Please try. Sincerely, Frances Goddard
